main event: Pilots from the U.S. Navy observed a bright green light and a bright light that made abrupt 90-degree turns in the area near Guam in June 1953.
interesting points: The green light was observed to come from above and behind the aircraft on a collision course, before making a sudden 90-degree turn and disappearing.
The bright light appeared larger than a star and was traveling at a high rate of speed before making an abrupt 90-degree turn and disappearing.
The reporting officer believed that the observations were of an interplanetary craft, and noted that numerous similar sightings had been reported by other personnel.
The incident was considered serious enough to warrant attention from intelligence agencies.
The sightings occurred at altitudes of 3,000 feet and 5,000 feet.
sighted object: a bright green light and a bright light
witnesses: Lt. Jg. R.H. Tillow, USN and Lt. Jg. W.A. Flaherty, USN
